title: Do you hate kassadin and ahri, completely wrecking you?
body: Try {{champion:34}}, she goes really well against these champions. She's fun to play(for me atleast), rewarding to master(see Froggen), and can easily carry a game.

replies.body: A good kassawin will never lose lane to a mage

https://image.prntscr.com/image/d3b79c6fca3a482b9c0f4f03cea93fc3.png
she seems to do fine into him

That seems interesting.
Most likely because of her passive GA that denies his engage
Or is it because her auto harass gets past his passive damage reduction and holding her stun means kassadin never gets to jump onto you and she can push hard enough to deny kassadin from roaming?
his passive only reduces magic damage, not physical so auto attacks are unaffected
and because levels 1-5 kassadin is a melee squish who anivia is definitely capable of bullying and she scales super hard
Ahri is basically a counter to Anivia, unless the player is just awful (most of them are, FOTM stuff).
I could guess why if I had to but why do you think Ahri is a counter to Anivia? Just wondering

Because unless you are A; bad or B; caught completely by surprise, Anivia cant do anything to you. Dodging her Q at long range is easy, at short range you can just throw out EWQ and do a ton of damage, either preventing her Q cast, or at least preventing the recast and stun.

If you have your ult up, you can ignore every one of her abilities except E, which will do no damage by itself. Her R only doubles E damage when fully expanded now.
Yup that's what I figured but I don't play either champ so thanks for the response

I main anivia mid and I ban ahri about half the time. She's just a bitch. She can go through your wall, nice q damage, good mobility to dodge your q, the charm really fucks you, of course. But I don't know anyone else who would really counter an ahri and I do OKAY against her in lane.
Malzahar, ekko, and yasuo can shit on her hard
Or you just play an AD mid and get {{item:3155}} right off the bat. If they're still killing you, their champ isn't the problem.
